messages.message: For model confidence score, does it only work for short documents? This doucment is 4 pages
we show that message whenever we don't have confidence, which may or may not be due to document length
What is our document length cut off?
it’s however long the short doc pipeline is. i think the context window of gpt probably (4k tokens?)
do we have roadmap item to have that increased?
I don’t think we agreed on an exact timeline. @lydia @Bastiane
yes 3K tokens. We're working on extending confidence score to long docs, but it requires model dev exploration, so we don't have a concrete delivery date yet

It is true though that we don’t show model confidence for tables and we still show this error message. I think we should be more generic here and just say something like “model confidence isn’t available”
We do show it for tables. Just not complex prompts. But complex prompts are going away right?
I thought @Nikolaos Kofinas mentioned that we don't have confidence for table?
Tables only work as complex prompts
Some tables can be extracted with basic prompts, in which case there is confidence information. The current behavior is *basic prompt/short-docs have confidence scores*.
Out of curiosity how is that 100% with the output missing the monthly payments compared to the prov tracking and it’s missing current due completely? @lydia
